libplcurve package¶

libplcurve.plcurve module¶

class libplcurve.plcurve.PlCurve¶

::plc_type

Static methods which create new PlCurves

from_file(FILE * file) → PlCurve¶
random_closed_polygon(RandomGenerator r, int nEdges) → PlCurve¶

Generate random length 2 space polygons of nEdges edges using the symmetric measure of Cantarella, Deguchi, Shonkwiler

random_open_polygon(RandomGenerator r, int nEdges) → PlCurve¶

Generate random length 2 space polygons of nEdges edges using the symmetric measure of Cantarella, Deguchi, Shonkwiler

random_closed_plane_polygon(RandomGenerator r, int nEdges) → PlCurve¶

Generate random length 2 planar polygons of nEdges edges using the symmetric measure of Cantarella, Deguchi, Shonkwiler

random_open_plane_polygon(RandomGenerator r, int nEdges) → PlCurve¶

Generate random length 2 planar polygons of nEdges edges using the symmetric measure of Cantarella, Deguchi, Shonkwiler

random_equilateral_closed_polygon(RandomGenerator r, int nEdges) → PlCurve¶

Random equilateral polygons (this uses a hedgehog/fold combination method). They are scaled to total length 2 in order to be comparable to the polygons generated by the other methods.

random_equilateral_open_polygon(RandomGenerator r, int nEdges) → PlCurve¶

Random equilateral polygons (this uses a hedgehog/fold combination method). They are scaled to total length 2 in order to be comparable to the polygons generated by the other methods.

loop_closure(RandomGenerator r, int cp, PlCurve openL, int nEdges) → PlCurve¶

Data operation methods

add_component(Strand[] strands[, bool open=false, Color[] colors=None, int add_as=-1])¶

Add a new Strand to this PlCurve as a component as component number add_as.

append(Vector3[] component[, bool open=false])¶

Append a new Strand to this PlCurve as a component

drop_component(int const cmp)¶

Delete component number cmp.

resize_colorbuf(int const cp, int const cc)¶

Change the size of the color buffer for a PlCurve, preserving existing data if it exists.

set_fixed(int const cmp, int const vert, plc_vector const point)¶

Set a constraint on a vertex or run of vertices.

constrain_to_line(int const cmp, int const vert, int const num_verts, plc_vector const tangent, plc_vector const point_on_line)¶

Constrain a vertex or number of vertices to a line.

constrain_to_plane(int const cmp, int const vert, int const num_verts, plc_vector const normal, double const dist_from_origin)¶

Constrain a vertex or number of vertices to a plane.

unconstrain(int const cmp, int const vert, int const num_verts)¶

Remove constraints on a vertex or run of vertices.

remove_constraint(plc_cst_kind const kind, plc_vector const [] vect) → int¶

Remove a constraint from the list of constraints returning the number of vertices thus set unconstrained.

remove_all_constraints()¶

Remove all constraints from the PlCurve.

fix_wrap()¶

Fix the “hidden vertices” for easy handling of closed components.

fix_constraints()¶

Fix all the vertices which are out of compliance with their constraints.

double_vertices() → PlCurve¶

Doubles the number of vertices of this PlCurve by inserting new vertices at midpoints of edges. Attempts to preserve constraints.

Spline methods

convert_to_spline() → Spline¶

Convert PlCurve to spline representation.

Geometric information method & attributes

num_edges() → int¶

Count edges in PlCurve, returning total.

num_vertices() → int¶

Count the vertices in a PlCurve.

vertex_num(int const cp, int const vt) → int¶

Compute an index between 0 and num_verts() - 1 for a (cp, vt) pair in a plCurve, using full wraparound addressing for closed components and repeating the last or first vertex for open ones. We guarantee that these numbers occur consecutively in dictionary order on the pairs (cp, vt).

cp_num(int wrapVt) → int¶

Convert back from a vertex_num universal index to a component number

vt_num(int wrapVt) → int¶

Convert back from a vertex_num universal index to a vertex number

turning_angle(int const component, int const vertex) → double¶

Compute the turning angle at a vertex. Uses wraparound addressing if needed.

MR_curvature(int const component, int const vertex) → double¶

Compute the MinRad-based curvature at vertex vt of component cp

total_curvature() → double¶

Compute the total curvature (defined as total turning angle) for PlCurve

total_torsion() → double¶

Find total (unsigned) torsion of the PlCurve.

mean_tangent(int const component, int const vertex) → plc_vector¶

Compute a (unit) tangent vector to L at vertex vert of component cmp by taking the incoming tangent and outgoing tangent and averaging them with their lengths taken into account.

For example, the average of (0.0,0.0,6.0) and (8.0,0.0,0.0) is (4.0,0.0,3.0) which normalizes to (0.8,0.0,0.6)

subarc_length(int const cmp, int const v1, int const v2) → double¶

Find the arclength distance from one vertex to another. On closed strands, give the shortest of the two options.

s(int const cmp, int const vert) → double¶

Find the arclength position of a vertex on the PlCurve. On a multi-component curve, s values add from 0 (0th vertex, 0th component) to the total arclength of the curve (last vertex, last component)

check_constraint() → double¶

Return how far a constraint is from being satisfied (sup norm).

mean_squared_chordlengths(int cp, int * skips, int nskips) → double¶

Return the average (squared) chordlengths of component cp at the array of skips given by nskips. Wraps if closed and doesn’t wrap if not.

pointset_diameter¶

plc_type.pointset_diameter

Calculate the diameter of the PlCurve, thinking of vertices as set of points in \(\mathbb{R}^3\).

Geometric operation methods

scale(double const alpha)¶

Scale this PlCurve (and its constraints) by a factor.

fold_move(int cp, int vt0, int vt1, double angle)¶

Perform a “fold” move

rotate(plc_vector axis, double angle)¶

Rotate this PlCurve around an axis.

random_rotate(plc_vector axis)¶

Rotate this PlCurve so the given axis points in the direction (0,0,1).

translate(plc_vector translation)¶

Translate by a vector.

perturb(double radius)¶

Perform a random perturbation. Does not perturb constrained vertices.

project(plc_vector normal)¶

Project this PlCurve to the plane (through the origin) normal to normal.

delete_arc(int cp, int vt1, int vt2)¶

Delete a subarc from a component of a plCurve between vt1 and vt2 (inclusive). If vt1 > vt2 (and the curve is closed), deletes forward from vt1 and wraps around to vt2. Vertices are renumbered so the successor of vt2 will become the new first vertex in a closed curve). If the component is open, it is split in two.

Symmetry methods

(Not yet implemented)

Topology methods
